ygData.subject: Re: How can I create a complete graph in Heritrix?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Pranay, I tested the extractor here and it gave me exactly what I want in JSON format. Now, I m trying to read the JSON file (HTML Metadata). Thank you

Hello Pranay,

I tested the extractor here and it gave me exactly what I wa=
nt in JSON format. Now, I'm trying to read the JSON file (HTML Metadata).
T=
hank you for your suggestion. 

I'm close to get a complete graph. Perhaps,=
 my great challenge will be space. Each warc files has about 1GB and it wro=
te 10 in a day.
Is there a way to write only informations about HTML Metada=
ta or other way to save space? 

Gordon, I read about a suggestion you gave=
 to write in "crawl.log" (http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawle=
r/message/4099) all the fathers of a URL. In the suggestion, you said that =
the guy has to create his own BdbUniqFilter to say what to do with the URI.=
 I downloaded the Heritrix-Open-Source but I got a bit confused about where=
 I have to modify to get this. I parse the files and I got a interesting fi=
le "/crawler/utils/BdbUriUniqFilter.java", but what I understood, this clas=
s create a hash of alreadyseen URIs but it doesn't tell anything to the URI=
 (if it must be reject or not). Am I correct or I have to edit another file=
? Where can I find the "critical point" in which the information about the =
URI will be written in crawl.log?

Thanks a lot the help people. When I get=
 the graph I will 'post' what I did to help people that have the same diffi=
culty.

Att.
Elverton.

ice that http://www.cfpn.mar.mil.br/ has more links that we have in outlink=

avis@ wrote:
> > >
> > > Elverton,
> > > 
> > > Have you looked at the meta=
data in the warcs? Each record should list
> > > extracted links regardless=
 of whether they were crawled due to scoping rules.
> > > Extract this set =
and intersect it with actual crawled uris to obtain a full
> > > graph with=
in what was crawled. You may also consider that the extractor also
> > > ha=
s a [high] limit on the number of URIs it extracts.
> > > 
> > > Travis
> >=
 > 
> > > On Mon, February 27, 2012 11:45 am, Elverton wrote:
> > > > Hello=
 everybody,
> > > >
> > > > As I sent a email to Gordon this afternoon (bel=
ow), I want to record and get
> > > > suggestion how can I get more informa=
tion about a URI before it get 'uniqued'.
> > > > As I read at "Mohr-et-al-=
2004', the way to decide what to do with a URI is at
> > > > Prefetch, more=
 exactly in Preselector. But I don't have a clue what filter or
> > > > rul=
e can help me. Any suggestions?
> > > >
> > > > Att.
> > > > Elverton.
> > =
> >
> > > > =3D> The original message:
> > > > ----------------------------=
------------------------------
> > > >  Hello Gordon,
> > > >
> > > >  My n=
ame is Elverton. I'm doing a research in a metric to estimate the numbers
>=
 > > > of URL of a domain. I have a problem to solve and you think you can =
help me.
> > > >
> > > >  I want to make a complete graph of all URL's coll=
ected but all I have from
> > > > crawl.log is the "father" of the URL and =
the URL. This would be necessary but
> > > > I have an misundertanding abou=
t one thing: If heritrix collect one URL,
> > > > suppose "yahoo.com" from =
"google.com". If the heritrix enter in "amazon.com"
> > > > and found "yaho=
o.com" again, in crawl.log will appear:
> > > >
> > > >  - - - yahoo.com - =
google.com
> > > >  - - - yahoo.com - amazon.com
> > > >
> > > >  or only:
=
> > > >
> > > >  - - - yahoo.com - google.com
> > > >
> > > >  So, the heri=
trix will ignore the found in "amazon.com" because it was already
> > > > f=
ound in "google.com"?

> > > >  Att.

> > =3D> Gordon's answer:
> > > >
> > > > ---------------------------------=
-------------------------
> > > >
> > > > You're correct, the crawl.log is =
not enough info to make a full web
> > > > graph... it only records the exa=
ct paths that led to a URI being first
> > > > discovered. You'd need to lo=
g more from the crawler before it 'uniques'
> > > > the URIs for crawling p=
urposes, or perform a post-crawl analysis on the
> > > > full link-containi=
ng content, to create the web graph.
> > > >
> > > > - Gordon
> > > >
> > >=
 > ----------------------------------------------------------
